Overviews The QR book is now the definitive presentation of the QSIM approach to qualitative reasoning. Qualitative Reasoning: Modeling and Simulation with Incomplete Knowledge . Reasoning with qualitative models. (as of 12-94) Qualitative Simulation The Basic Idea B. J. Kuipers. Describes a simulation technique that uses a cross between a state-based representation and a history-based representation. The manuscript "Focusing qualitative simulation using temporal logic" is an extension of the paper published in TIME-96. Control of Hybrid Systems using Qualitative Simulation . University of Texas Artificial Intelligence Laboratory TR AI96-245, January 1996. [Abstract] Building Qualitative Models CC David W. Franke and Daniel Dvorak. In Working Papers of the International Workshop on Qualitative Reasoning (QR-94), 1994. Expert systems for monitoring and control. Daniel Dvorak & Benjamin Kuipers. The model is based on the previous QSIM model developed by Herbert Kay [1992]. Doctoral dissertation, Computer Science Department, University of Texas at Austin, May 1992. Raman Rajagopalan and Benjamin Kuipers. A model for integrated qualitative spatial and dynamic reasoning about physical systems. Qualitative reasoning about dynamic change in the spatial properties of a physical system. Rajagopalan, R. and B. Kuipers.
